newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Losses in leading stocks drive Slovak bourse down.
newsitem.headline: Losses in leading stocks drive Slovak bourse down.

text.p: Major Slovak stocks closed mixed in moderate trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange on Thursday, with losses to several blue chips pulling the SAX index down 1.97 points to 210.72.
The biggest loser was unlisted drug maker Slovakofarma, which closed down 70 crowns at 4,700.
But dealers pointed out that only 72 shares in Slovakofarma traded, and low volumes also plagued most of the issues on the 16-share index.

"The bourse's rally over the past few weeks probably lasted too long and was too fragile to continue further," said Radovan Dzugas of Creditanstalt, adding that the downtrend should continue in the mid-term.

"Apart from low liquidity, which a a chronic problem on the BSE, the market desperately needs strong market makers quoting both sides of offers to give it fundamental grounds for a stronger trend," he said.
Overall volume rose to 380,897 shares, boosted mainly by direct trades, from 227,889 shares on Wednesday. Turnover increased to 527.97 million crowns, from 285.65 million.
Oil refiner Slovnaft gained six crowns to close at 971, but dealers said they saw little room for a longer-term increase. Steel producer VSZ lost nine crowns to close at 706.
"VSZ should not fall significantly lower, given it's a fundamentaly good issue," Dzugas said.
Nafta fell 49 crowns to 1,601 crowns. Brokers said the issue now appeared to be a good target for speculative investment due to its low price. -- Peter Laca, Bratislava Newsroom, 42-7-521-8402
